resources.string: Force new IPv6 address assignment and/or re-create 6to4 tunnel
WARNING: privacy extensions not in use, device can be globally tracked
matches locally visible default route address, 6to4 tunneling possible
does not match locally visible default route address, 6to4 tunneling not possible
Local IPv4 address with default route:
Unable to determine address, resolver server not reachable via
Unable to determine local default address, unknown routes set
"IPv6Config could not enable address privacy on all interfaces, your privacy is NOT guaranteed at this time!"
IPv6Config could not disable address privacy on all interfaces, some may still use random addresses
IPv6Config could not configure IPv6 6to4 tunnel
IPv6Config tried to configure IPv6 6to4 tunnel, but IPv4 addresses not compatible
Create (6to4) IPv6 tunnel when no native default route is available
(will probably not work with current settings)
Advanced setting (only if you know what you are doing): Ignore externally resolved IPs and force 6to4 tunnel with internally visible IPv4 address

Copyright (C) Ren√© Mayrhofer (2011)
IPv6Config allows to modify kernel settings to configure the Linux IPv6 stack, most notably to enable IPv6 address privacy extensions. See http://www.mayrhofer.eu.org/android-ipv6config for details.

This application is published as open source under the terms of the GNU General Public License (GPL) version 3. With the exception of the application icons, it may be modified and redistributed as long as the modified source code is also made available under this license.

Icons designed by Doris Mayrhofer.

Superuser/root access not detected. This application will not work without access to the "su" binary, which typically comes with the "SuperUser" application on rooted Android devices.\n\nPlease root your device and try again.
